pages.text: Panderodus is a Conodont that originated in the Ordivician and died out in the Late Devonian period. Due to the discovery of rare conodont body fossils, it was revealed that Panderodus had a thicker body compared to the more slender bodies of other conodonts. They were also macrophagous predators, meaning they attacked larger prey and studies have shown that they were venomous.
